intro: Ligustrum glabrinerve, commonly known as the smooth-veined privet, is a flowering plant native to parts of East Asia. It is a deciduous shrub characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are smooth to the touch. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers in clusters, which are followed by black, fleshy berries. It thrives in a variety of soil types and is often used in landscaping due to its adaptability and ornamental value. The smooth-veined leaves are a distinguishing feature that sets it apart from other privet species.
